properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 10 at 4:00AM EST until February 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Jackson KY
properties.description:
...More Rounds of Moderate to Heavy Rains Coming to Far Southeast
Kentucky Today Into Tuesday Morning...

.A slow moving frontal boundary will waver back and forth over
eastern Kentucky through much of week leading to several rounds of
moderate to heavy rainfall for the area. The first of these will
affect far southeast Kentucky the most today and into Tuesday
morning. Due to this rain falling on already saturated soil,
renewed flooding is possible - especially in the headwaters of the
Cumberland River.

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Watch for portions of south central Kentucky and
southeast Kentucky, including the following areas, in south
central Kentucky, McCreary and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky,
Bell, Harlan, and Knox.

* From noon EST today through Tuesday morning

* Moderate to heavy rainfall remains a concern today through
Tuesday morning, as a slow moving cold front pushes into the
area. This additional rainfall, on top of saturated soils, will
lead to a potential of renewed flooding.

* Minor flooding of low lying areas, as well as rivers, creeks,
and streams will be possible.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON EST TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
